intro: Pilosella peleteriana, commonly known as the alpine groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, providing a distinctive appearance. Pilosella peleteriana is known for its small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
